thread.title: Jamie Carragher admits what he really thinks about Frank Lampard's career | GiveMeSport
thread.title_full: Jamie Carragher admits what he really thinks about Frank Lampard's career | GiveMeSport

title: Jamie Carragher admits what he really thinks about Frank Lampard's career | GiveMeSport
text:
Jamie Carragher admits what he really thinks about Frank Lampard's career Published 24/7 
Now that Frank Lampard has hung up his boots and brought an end to his incredibly successful career, his former colleagues and adversaries on the pitch have been pouring the tributes to celebrate what a fantastic player he was. 
The 38-year-old informed the world of his decision to call it a day on his personal Instagram page on Thursday morning, and understandably, the platitudes have been coming thick and fast from all over the world. 
And now that he is no longer a threat to his former club Liverpool, Jamie Carragher now feels comfortable enough to reveal what he actually thinks of the midfielder. Article continues below 
With Lampard retiring having won 106 England caps, three Premier League titles, four FA Cups and the Champions League in 2012, it's fair to say he got the better of Carragher in the success stakes. 
But at international level they were teammates, and there's no doubt that a strong friendship was formed between them. Article continues below
